results.content: Theory videos are fantastic. Work can be and should be done to improve demonstration videos as they consume lot of time without delivering significantly productive content and repeating things again and again.
results.content_html: Theory videos are fantastic. Work can be and should be done to improve demonstration videos as they consume lot of time without delivering significantly productive content and repeating things again and again.

results.content: Al querer comenzar mi carrera como científico de datos, había realizado muchos cursos sobre machine learning, la mayoría atacaba los mismos problemas con soluciones rebuscadas y poco prácticas. Esta serie de vídeos son de las enseñanzas sobre ciencia de datos y machine learning más valiosas que he podido conseguir, felicitaciones.

the sentence above is so wrong;

results.content: Very satisfied with this course. I liked the methodology, the combination of the intuition lectures with the practical use of efficient and straightforward scripts. Excellent both instructors! Thank you!
results.content_html: Very satisfied with this course. I liked the methodology, the combination of the intuition lectures with the practical use of efficient and straightforward scripts. Excellent both instructors! Thank you!

results.content: For overall, this course provides some clear intuition about machine learning and practical implementation (very good hands-on). Yet there is a vague explanation about reinforcement learning and there is also no explanation about XGBoost (hands-on only). This course is suitable for those of you who want to study Machine Learning without doing some math. But i think, for the better understanding in machine learning is started from their mathematics.
results.content_html: For overall, this course provides some clear intuition about machine learning and practical implementation (very good hands-on). Yet there is a vague explanation about reinforcement learning and there is also no explanation about XGBoost (hands-on only). This course is suitable for those of you who want to study Machine Learning without doing some math. But i think, for the better understanding in machine learning is started from their mathematics.

results.content:
The course is very good and broad, exactly what I was looking for.

Pros:
- Quick overview of almos all ML fields, with hands-down explanations of the concepts behind them (in all but 1 case - XGBoost)

- Many resources provided, both as downloadable content and references and bibliography content

- There's active instructors in the Q&A section that can help you with issues you may have.

- Almost all content is done in both Python and R (only missing a CNN R implmentation)


Cons:
- Some content is slightly out of date, as certain libaries and packages used throughout the course have some differences in their API calls.

- There's some areas I wish were explained in more depth

- Some resources are provided as-is, with no explanation about them (only a few cases)

The course is excellent for a fast dive in ML, covering all main fileds with a variety of techniques:
- Dimensionality Reduction with PCA and LDA
- Regression & Classification with a handful of approaches. Linear, logistic, random forest, naive bayesian...
- Association Rule
- Data Clustering: k-means, SVM, 
- Neural Networks

Almost all content is explained nicely.
I did miss a lecture for the XGBoost model, or even some pointers to bibliography so I could do the research myself. It was suprising as all other sections do have at least 1 single lecture regarding the theory or concepts behind the topic covered.

Some lectures seem to drag unnecessarily. While I think it's great lecturers take their time to explain key areas and concepts, more than a few times the lecture would get stuck for 5 mins + on some area that was explained at the beginning of the course, not adding anything new.

Overall, I give it 4.5/5.
The course is very good. The negative points stand out simply because everything else is so polished. Totally recommended if you have no knowledge of ML or if, just like me, you already have some knowledge of certain areas and wish to expand your skillset AND/OR you already have knowledge of ML in either Python or R and wish to learn the other.

About the latter point, my take from the course is that certain parts of ML are much more convenient to implement in R, even if (to my opinion) R is not as straightforward as Python.

As a final note:
I'd personally recommend you already have at least some programming experience before taking the course. As I mentioned at the beginning, some parts of the course are slightly out of date. Even if they are up to date, some things may not be as straightforward as shown in the lectures. You may need to correct the code yourself, which will require you to have basic notions of object-oriented programming. You can always check the Q&A for people with the same problem as you (everyone has them at some point), or ask the question yourself if you can't find the answer or would like some more clarifications.

Farewell and, as you will hear time and time again throughout this course should you decide to enroll in it, happy machine learning.

Pros:
- Quick overview of almos all ML fields, with hands-down explanations of the concepts behind them (in all but 1 case - XGBoost)

- There's active instructors in the Q&A section that can help you with issues you may have.

Cons:
- Some content is slightly out of date, as certain libaries and packages used throughout the course have some differences in their API calls.

- There's some areas I wish were explained in more depth

- Some resources are provided as-is, with no explanation about them (only a few cases)

Almost all content is explained nicely.
I did miss a lecture for the XGBoost model, or even some pointers to bibliography so I could do the research myself. It was suprising as all other sections do have at least 1 single lecture regarding the theory or concepts behind the topic covered.

The course is very good. The negative points stand out simply because everything else is so polished. Totally recommended if you have no knowledge of ML or if, just like me, you already have some knowledge of certain areas and wish to expand your skillset AND/OR you already have knowledge of ML in either Python or R and wish to learn the other.

About the latter point, my take from the course is that certain parts of ML are much more convenient to implement in R, even if (to my opinion) R is not as straightforward as Python.

I'd personally recommend you already have at least some programming experience before taking the course. As I mentioned at the beginning, some parts of the course are slightly out of date. You may need to correct the code yourself, which will require you to have basic notions of object-oriented programming. You can always check the Q&A for people with the same problem as you (everyone has them at some point), or ask the question yourself if you can't find the answer or would like some more clarifications.

Farewell and, as you will hear time and time again throughout this course should you decide to enroll in it, happy machine learning.

results.content: Good course learned lot of New algorithms. But the problem is that. There is no mathematical concepts explained. I really enjoyed the Reinforcement Learning Part. The another negative part is boring repetitive practical tutorials. For newbies it's fine.
results.content_html: Good course learned lot of New algorithms. But the problem is that. There is no mathematical concepts explained. I really enjoyed the Reinforcement Learning Part. The another negative part is boring repetitive practical tutorials. For newbies it's fine.

results.content: The content and instructors are very good. The only negative comment is in relation to some modules where the mathematical explanation part was weak

results.content: O curso foi incrível, ótimas explicações teóricas e a pratica é lecionada de forma simples fazendo com que o assunto fique mais fácil de entender. Recomendo o todos que queiram aprender mais sobre machine learning.

results.content: The course gave an hands-on experience on all the machine learning models. The difficulty is medium if you don't have any prior knowledge about machine learning or python, with basic knowledge in python the course is very easy to understand and implement.
results.content_html: The course gave an hands-on experience on all the machine learning models. The difficulty is medium if you don't have any prior knowledge about machine learning or python, with basic knowledge in python the course is very easy to understand and implement.
